titleStmt.title: To the Kings Most Excellent Majesty. Dread Sovereign, having seen a proclamation wherein your Majesty complains of the injuries you receive in your customs, I could not withhold, but, as in duty bound, humbly present you with a few of those malignant roots from whence they spring, whereby navigation and trade are also much decayed ...
titleStmt.author: Bower, Richard, fl. 1662.

titleStmt.title: To the Kings Most Excellent Majesty. Dread Sovereign, having seen a proclamation wherein your Majesty complains of the injuries you receive in your customs, I could not withhold, but, as in duty bound, humbly present you with a few of those malignant roots from whence they spring, whereby navigation and trade are also much decayed ...
titleStmt.author: Bower, Richard, fl. 1662.
Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.).
